intro: Cheiranthus parnassi, commonly known as Parnassian honesty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Cheiranthus parnassi is often found in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
